intro: Conostegia iteophylla, commonly known as the red-stemmed cypress, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, scale-like leaves and distinctive reddish-brown stems. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for horticultural use in warm climates. Conostegia iteophylla is also valued for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions and resist pests and diseases.
